definition: to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men
sentences.chinese: 在思念夜中，异象之间，世人沉睡的时候。

sentences.english: Satiated , it finally slept, alone in the void.
sentences.chinese: 终于他满足了，孤独地沉睡在虚空之海。

sentences.english: There is a gaina asleep within every man . when the giant awaken , miracle happen !
sentences.chinese: 每个人心中都有一个沉睡的巨人。

sentences.english: Everything is sleeping now, expect the clock and me.
sentences.chinese: 现在，除了钟与我相伴，一切都在沉睡着。

sentences.english: Let the sleeping death seep through.
sentences.chinese: 苹果醮毒，让死之沉睡渗入。

sentences.english: Atzel was so exhausted with happiness that he slept right through it.
sentences.chinese: 阿采尔快乐得精疲力尽，整个葬礼过程中都沉睡着。

sentences.english: Andyou are pure beside me as a sleeping amber.
sentences.chinese: 你在我身后纯洁的像一枚正在沉睡的琥珀。

sentences.english: We slept for two months and now we are fresh.
sentences.chinese: 我们沉睡了两个月，现在睡狮已醒。

sentences.english: All people are children when they sleep.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都是孩子，当他们沉睡。

sentences.english: The sky is still black. The world is still asleep.
sentences.chinese: 天空仍漆黑一片，整个世界还在沉睡。

sentences.english: Do you retain any connections to your Sleeper life?
sentences.chinese: 你和你的沉睡者生活还有联系吗？

sentences.english: The Big Sleep Survey 2010 is a real citizen science research project.
sentences.chinese: 2010沉睡调查是一项真实的市民科学调查项目。

sentences.english: Asthe light fades and the city goes to sleep, two forces emerge.
sentences.chinese: 随着光线渐暗，随着城市进入沉睡，两股力量出现了。

sentences.english: After decades of slumbering underachievement, the Bear is back.
sentences.chinese: 在沉睡了十几年后，北极熊回来了。

sentences.english: Will the hormones wake the sleeping dragon?
sentences.chinese: 贺尔蒙会唤醒这沉睡的恶魔吗？

sentences.english: It's not that He simply wakes up those in a deep, deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 他并不只是将他们从沉睡中唤醒。

definition: to come to/to awaken/to regain consciousness
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
